intro: Helmia furcata, commonly known as the redstem sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in the summer months. Helmia furcata is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
